definition: promise of brilliant young person (idiom); showing extraordinary gifts

sentences.english: Some are simply large, while others are utterly towering.
sentences.chinese: 有些只是大，而有些則是完全崢嶸。

sentences.english: Zhengrong in a few years developing a successful service company of China Mobile.
sentences.chinese: 在數年的崢嶸發展中公司成功服務中國移動。

sentences.english: The two generals are recalling the memorable years of the past.
sentences.chinese: 兩位老將軍正在回憶當年的崢嶸歲月。

sentences.english: Mira Wang, to recognize his own daughter to college impostor fact.
sentences.chinese: 王崢嶸承認自己的女兒冒名頂替上大學的事實。

sentences.english: Gong Xinglun romantic smile say, not lofty, it is a misery.
sentences.chinese: 龔興倫浪漫地笑了笑說不，不崢嶸，那是一種苦難。

sentences.english: Time is like an arrow, time elapse quickly, 50 years extraordinary years blends in historical endless flow.
sentences.chinese: 光陰似箭，日月如梭，50年崢嶸歲月融入歷史長河。

sentences.english: This poem sums up that period very vividly memorable days.
sentences.chinese: 這首詩非常形象地概括了那段崢嶸歲月。

sentences.english: Qiaoyue lofty heaven and earth, is blowing side of the body to send Mountain.
sentences.chinese: 喬嶽崢嶸天地中，飄零身寄衡山側。

sentences.english: Recall the eventful years, look forward to prosperous future.
sentences.chinese: 憶往昔崢嶸歲月，望未來前程更輝煌。

sentences.english: He won't forget years of that paragraph of extraordinary forever.
sentences.chinese: 他永遠不會忘記那一段崢嶸歲月。

sentences.english: In New York a new tower is taking shape at Ground Zero.
sentences.chinese: 在紐約，世貿中心廢墟之上，一座新的高樓漸露崢嶸。

definition: vast and mighty (of river or ocean)/broad and powerful
Wanli township in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan

lit. warp and weft in weaving; vertically and horizontal/length and breadth/criss-crossed/able to move unhindered/abbr. for 合縱連橫|合纵连横[He2 zong4 Lian2 heng2], School of Diplomacy during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
a snap of the fingers/a short moment/in a flash/in the twinkling of an eye
to visit places famous for their scenery
to rustle in the air/to rustle/to sough/bleak/desolate/chilly
continuous/unbroken/uninterrupted/extending forever into the distance (of mountain range, river etc)
lit. ten thousand fathoms/fig. extremely high or deep/lofty/bottomless
